data.name: Brent's Algorithm / Brent-Hashing
data.description:
You are asked to implement brent's algorithm to fill a hash table.
https://de.wikipedia.org/wiki/Brent-Hashing

the hash table has some size. we name it "arr" here, short for array

you'll get an int[] with values to insert into the table.
you will never get too many values.
alpha=(values/places available) will be <= 1

--------------------------
how brent works:
insertion of key k:
start with address i=h(k)
if i is filled, look at
b=i-h'(k) mod size and b'=i-h'(k') mod size where
k'=arr[i]

is b free, set k on b
else if b' is free, set k on i and k' on b'

otherwise try position k on i=b

--------------------------

h(x)=x mod size
h'(x)= (x mod 7) mod size

example:

[1,2,4]
->
[0][1][2][0][4][0][0][0][0][0][0]

hint: java's modulus doesn't behave like it should. make it correct.
